definition: classics/sacred book/scripture/to pass through/to undergo/to bear/to endure/warp (textile)/longitude/menstruation/channel (TCM)/abbr. for economics 經濟|经济[jing1 ji4]
to decline/to wane/to become weak or feeble

sentences.english: Third, set off firecrackers and the customs temporary enduring a tradition.
sentences.chinese: 第三，放鞭炮也是我国习俗傍边经久不衰的一项传统。

sentences.english: And that's a perennial issue in philosophy.
sentences.chinese: 这在哲学上也是一个经久不衰的问题。

sentences.english: But now, your comedy can live on forever.
sentences.chinese: 但是现在，你的喜剧能够经久不衰。

sentences.english: It is not difficult to find the reasons for their enduring appeal.
sentences.chinese: 找到其吸引力能经久不衰的原因并不难。

sentences.english: It has been one of the most enduring genres in the business.
sentences.chinese: 这是影视业中最经久不衰的类型之一。

sentences.english: The time-honored tradition, of course, is warm milk, also a good source of tryptophan.
sentences.chinese: 经久不衰的尝试是喝热牛奶，其中同样含有色氨酸。

sentences.english: The river supplies water to the city unfailingly .
sentences.chinese: 这条河经久不衰地为这个城市供水。

sentences.english: Kant's theory of things in themselves is an unfailing question for study.
sentences.chinese: 康德的物自体学说是康德研究中一个经久不衰的课题。

sentences.english: Some tools are perennial; occasionally, some are obsoleted outright.
sentences.chinese: 一些工具经久不衰，有些工具完全过时了。

sentences.english: Their bonds with the American people are deep and enduring, and Czechs have made great contributions to the United States over many decades -- including in my hometown of Chicago.
sentences.chinese: 他们与美国人民的联系根深蒂固，经久不衰。

definition: fashionable for a while (idiom); all the rage
to push out the old and bring in the new (idiom); to innovate
lit. to fly one's banner on a solitary tree (idiom); fig. to act as a loner/to stand out/to develop one's own school/to have attitude of one's own
passed on from generation to generation (idiom); to hand down
understood by everyone (idiom); well known/a household name
to treasure/to be very fond of
what's frequently heard can be repeated in detail (idiom)
to sell strongly/to be in great demand
